title: Lori Loughlin has yoga day in LA amid mounting legal problems while daughter Olivia Jade shops
text:
Lori Loughlin was snapped in Los Angeles Sunday getting in a yoga session, days after her daughter Olivia Jade was seen shopping in West Hollywood, California, amid the family's ongoing legal tangles.

Loughlin, 55, donned activewear on the weekend outing, looking to relieve some stress amid the latest developments in her case in the college admissions scandal, as she won't have to return to court throughout the balance of the year.

Loughlin wore a magenta long-sleeved zip-up top paired with blue leggings with pink sandals, sunglasses and a khaki visor as she kept a low-profile on the outing.

Out and about: Lori Loughlin, 55, was snapped in Los Angeles Sunday getting in a yoga session amid her family's ongoing legal tangles, with news this week that she won't have to return to court throughout the balance of the year

She carried a yoga mat and had headphones plugged into her phone.

The actress, who played Rebecca 'Aunt Becky' Katsopolis on Full House and its Netflix reboot, and her husband designer Mossimo Giannulli, 56, are charged in the scheme - dubbed Operation Varsity Blues - in which federal prosecutors said parents paid money to have their kids admitted into colleges despite lack of merits.

Olivia was with a pal Thursday as she was seen shopping at the the boutique Madhappy. She beamed as she donned a white hooded sweatshirt with black shorts and off-white boots with thick soles.

She rounded out her casual ensemble with a blue ballcap and black sunglasses and toted a black purse and a Madhappy tote-bag.

Stylish: Loughlin, 55, donned blue and magenta activewear on the weekend outing

Carefree: Olivia was with a pal Thursday as she was seen shopping at the the boutique Madhappy in West Hollywood

The couple has pleaded not guilty to accusations they shelled out $500,000 to admissions fixer Rick Singer to have daughters Isabella Rose, 21, and Olivia, 20, recruited onto the University of Southern California's rowing team despite no background in the sport.

Actress Felicity Huffman, 56, last month was sentenced to 14 days in prison after pleading guilty to mail fraud and honest services mail fraud in connection with the case.

This past week, federal authorities in Massachusetts said their next step is a status conference slated for January 17, 2020, according to Deseret News. Loughlin will not be mandated to attend the hearing, which will consists of the judges and lawyers mapping out the timeline of the case.
